meta.content: Education; Corrections; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

abstract.p: Correction of August 19 article on organizations that seek to manage some of New York City's lowest-performing schools

block.p: An article on Saturday about organizations that seek to manage some of New York City's lowest-performing schools referred incorrectly to the status of Boys Harbor Inc., a nonprofit group in Harlem. Its application for a charter school license was approved by the trustees of the State University of New York in January and was approved by the Board of Regents in April; the school is scheduled to open in Harlem this fall. Boys Harbor did not fail to get a license.
